tajweed_content_desc: The science of tajweed is the knowledge used to understand the rules and methods of reciting (pronouncing) the letters of the Qur'an correctly and beautifully. Its purpose is to preserve the recitation of the Qur'an from errors and changes, as well as to safeguard the mouth from reading mistakes. Studying the science of tajweed is a communal obligation (Fardlu Kifayah), while reciting the Qur'an correctly according to the rules of tajweed is an individual obligation (Fardlu 'Ain).

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Mimi
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Mimi tajweed law happens when mim sakinah meets the letters of idgham mimi (Ù…), it is pronounced in the same way as mim shaddah.
tajweed_laws.detail: The letter of Idgham Mimi is only one. The letter is mim. So, Idgham Mimi is the meeting of two mim letters. The way to pronounce it is the same as pronouncing the mim with shaddah. Because, mim shaddah is a combination of mim sakinah and mim with harakah.

tajweed_laws.name: Ghunnah
tajweed_laws.summary: Ghunnah tajweed law happens if there is a shaddah on the letter mim (Ù…Ù‘) and nun (Ù†), it is pronounced with a nasal sound and is called Ghunnah.
tajweed_laws.detail: Ghunnah means: nasaling (at the bridge of the nose). So the way to read it is by humming the letters mim and nun taysdid on the bridge of the nose for 2 - 3 harakah.

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Mutamasilain
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Mutamasilain tajweed law happens when a letter meets a similar letter, with the same makhraj and characteristic, where the first letter is sukun (silent) and the second letter has a harakah.
tajweed_laws.detail:
The way to read it is by inserting the first sukun letter into the second harokah letter. And being pressured, he was detained for no more than one harokah.
The rule of Idgham Mutamasilain has exceptions. If the letter Wawu with sukun meets the letter (Ùˆ) or if the letter Ya' with sukun meets the letter (ÙŠ), then it should not be pronounced with Idgham (merging) into the second letter, but it should be read with a long pronunciation or MAD as it is supposed to be. An additional exception is that if the letter before the Wawu (Ùˆ) or Ya (ÙŠ) has a fathah harakat, then Idgham can be applied (https://www.khudzilkitab.com/2019/01/idgham-mutamatsilain-lengkap.html).

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Arid Lissukun
tajweed_laws.summary: Mad Arid Lissukun tajweed law happens if there is Mad Thobi'i or Mad Layyin followed by a waqf (stopping place).
tajweed_laws.detail:
There are 3 ways to read it:
a. What is more important is that it is read long, the same as Mad Wajib Mutashil (three alif or six harakah).
b. The middle (medium) one can only be read as two Alif or four harokats (twice Mad Thobi'i).
c. The sortest one may be only read as Mad Thobi'i (two harakah).
